summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 15, 2019. The sheets are used to document staff observations of inmates in continuous locked-down status, such as administrative detention or disciplinary segregation, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.

events.title: Routine Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York's Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates in locked-down status throughout the day.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York's Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The sheets are dated July 15, 2019, and document 30-minute observation checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status.
The checks are required to be conducted on an irregular schedule, with inmates observed at least twice per hour.
The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, indicating a chain of oversight for inmate monitoring.
No specific inmate or staff names are legibly recorded in the provided text; the fields contain initials or signatures that are not clearly decipherable.
